definitions: To see an event, typically a crime or accident, happen.
To be present at an event and have personal knowledge of it.
To attest to the truth of something by signing one's name.
To be the place or time at which something happens or is observed.
examples: She will witness the signing of the contract.
Many people witnessed the solar eclipse.
The document was witnessed by a notary public.
The 20th century witnessed rapid technological advancements.
